snippet: The storm has divided Manhattan into two distinct places: one where restaurants serve hot food and warm water runs from the tap, and another where phones are dead and a shower is just a dream.
abstract: Aftermath of Hurricane Katrina temporarily creates two distinct Manhattans at the boundary around 40th Street on the East Side; on one side, power and hot water are not to be found, while electricity and services are abundant just over the line; people from downtown have emerged from the cold and darkness to look for food, water and warmth north of 39th Street.
lead_paragraph: The storm has divided Manhattan into two distinct places: one where restaurants serve hot food and warm water runs from the tap, and another where phones are dead and a shower is just a dream.

headline.seo: Above 40th Street, the Powerless Go to Recharge
headline.main: Above 40th Street, the Powerless Go to Recharge
headline.print_headline: Heading North to Midtown, Manhattan’s Powerless Find Places to Recharge
